results.title: Cargo handling at the ports
results.creator_credit: Air Ministry and Great Britain. Ministry of Transport
results.brief_description: Deals with the equipment used in the handling of ships’ cargoes. Among the mechanical appliances shown are various types of crane, pick-up devices, hoppers, conveyors to transport goods from holds to railway trucks, grain elevators, floating elevators, motor tractors and trailers, electric tractors, fork-lift trucks, elevating trucks, the Ross carrier, and power-operated truck mover. Demonstrates how this equipment enables goods to be handled more quickly, so increasing the capacity of the docks.

results.title: Careful, he might hear you
results.creator_credit: New South Wales Film Corporation, Syme International, Jill Robb and Carl Schultz
results.brief_description: Set in Australia in the 1930’s, this film is the poignant but powerful story of a bitter struggle between two sisters to gain possession of a little boy. The boy is PS, who lives with his Aunt Lila and Uncle George who raised him from a baby and cherish him as their own. PS’ world crashes around him when his beautiful and rich Aunt Vanessa arrives from England and takes him to live with her in a luxurious Sydney harbourside mansion. Vanessa tries to mould PS to her standards and new way of life. PS must face the sisters’ lies, manipulations and mutual hatred. The web of deceit grows, and PS is forced to act as a go-between. It is through his father, a stranger to him, that PS finds the key to his future. Cast includes Wendy Hughes, Nicolas Gledhill, Robyn Nevin, John Hargreaves and Geraldine Turner.

results.title: Carefree
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Pandro S. Berman and Mark Sandrich
results.brief_description: Fickle Amanda Cooper (Ginger Rogers) has postponed her wedding so often that her fiance sends her to his best friend, a psychoanalyst, (Fred Astaire) for treatment. In spite of hypnosis and assorted other wacky attempts at remedies Amanda falls in love with her psychoanalyst. Cast also includes Ralph Bellamy, Luella Gear, Jack Carson. Lyrics and music by Irving Berlin.

results.title: Careers in science and technology
results.creator_credit: Academy Film Productions, Ronald Mason and Bruce McNaughton
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Way to Tomorrow”.
Explains the scope of employment in scientific and technical fields in Australia. Shows many examples of work in laboratories and workshops and out of doors, covering research and application in physical and biological sciences, meteorology, geology, engineering, instrumentation and automation, power generation, food industries etc. Gives guidance on the prerequisites necessary to enter the fields.

results.title: Careers in electronic engineering
results.brief_description: A vocational guide to radio, television and electronics. Opens with a discussion on the relative merits of training programs offered by American trade schools, technical institutes, and universities. Explains how the training in electronic theory and practice gained at a technical institute is specially suited for students planning a career in radio, television or electronic engineering. The film shows various aspects of training at the Valparaiso TEchnical Insitute and shows the opportunities which exist for graduates in television, radio, police radio, aviation, marine radio, and electronic engineering.

results.title: Careers in design
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A program which provides an introduction to the design process and how is applied. Aspects mentioned are: function, aesthetics, manufacturing and marketing. Examples of environmental, product and graphics design are illustrated.

results.title: Careers in building
results.creator_credit: Academy Film Productions, Ronald Mason and Bruce McNaughton
results.brief_description: A vocational guidance film on the building industry. Shows the erection of a tall city office block; the men and women of the building industry at work in their diverse activities; the craftsmanship and skill required to erect a typical Australian brick veneer home; the development of a new airline terminal; and the construction work involved in a guided missile rocket pad.

results.title: Careers for girls
results.creator_credit: Forum Films, March of Time and Time-Life Productions
results.brief_description: This segment, produced as part of ‘The March of Time’ newsreel and documentary series, provides general career advice for young women in post-WWII America. The suggested career paths are reflective of the late 1940s, focusing on areas such as office work, nursing, fashion and retail. But rather than restrict the options to these areas, career advancement and less traditional career paths, like science and medicine, are addressed. Pointers on how to find a job matched to your personality are interspersed with successful women in each particular field. ‘The March of Time’ series was produced between 1935 and 1951 and, whilst a very popular series, failed to make money due to high production costs.

results.title: Careering into marriage
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Robin Hughes and Susan Doring
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working series”.
One of a series of films about attitudes to work. Stresses the importance of career planning for girls, even though they may marry and leave work permanently or have a broken career. Many women become the breadwinners of their family, and others manage to successfully combine career and family.
